intro: Calotheca brizoides, commonly known as the bristle moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with leafy shoots that are often covered in fine, bristle-like structures. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are usually short and club-shaped, developing from the base of the leaves. Calotheca brizoides plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
